page.title: 16PAT SEED
page.content: Christie's told Pat the scanner would cost &500,000 and Pat said she would raise the money.The Pat Seed Appeal Fund began on 15th March 1977 when Mr Brierley donated &1,100.The fund grew quickly and soon 68 branches were helping the Appeal Fund in the North West,from Wrexham to Barrow.Millions of people,young and old,famous and ordinary, held Fetes,raffles and sponsored events.By 1980 the scanner was installed in Christie's. The fund raised over &3 million and provided the hospital with special equipment.Thousands have been treated and cured. Pat was awarded the M.B.E.,wrote a book called "One day at a time" and appeared on "This is your life".Pat died 2nd August 1984,weeks after her husband was killed in the Abbeystead disaster.HER WORK CONTINUES.
